Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Rectum \Rec"tum\ (-t?m), n. [NL. (sc. intestinum), fr. L. rectus straight. See {Right}.] (Anat.) The terminal part of the large intestine; -- so named because supposed by the old anatomists to be straight. See Illust. under {Digestive}. [1913 Webster]
rectum n : the terminal section of the alimentary canal; from the sigmoid flexure to the anus [also: {recta} (pl)]
